alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 26 at 2:58PM MDT until July 26 at 3:30PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM MDT FOR EAST CENTRAL FREMONT COUNTY... At 256 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 10 miles east of Ocean Lake to near Hidden Valley to 11 miles north of Sand Draw, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. At 250 pm, 70 mph was reported at several locations just west of Riverton. 60 to 65 mph wind gusts were also reported at the Riverton Airport. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe storms will be near... Boysen State Park and Hidden Valley around 300 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Shoshoni. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. If on or near Ocean Lake and Boysen Reservoir, get away from the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 15 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
